intro: Gilia tenuiflora var. davyi, commonly known as the narrow-flowered gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight hairy texture. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features.
